metadata.name: DesignAli Creative Suite Design System
metadata.description: A comprehensive design system profile for a modern creative suite application with professional tools and resources

primary.description: Deep neutral used for text and primary UI elements

background.description: Pure white in light mode, deep dark in dark mode

accent.description: Gradients using vibrant colors for hero sections and emphasis

border.description: Subtle border color for separating elements

iconColors.description: Vibrant colors applied to individual icons for visual variety
iconColors.usage: Applied to individual app/feature icons for visual distinction and personality

sans.name: Geist
sans.usage: Primary font for all UI elements, body text, headings

mono.name: Geist Mono
mono.usage: Code snippets, technical content, specialized displays

lineHeight.relaxed: 1.625 (leading-relaxed) - used for body text for better readability
lineHeight.usage: Maintains comfortable reading experience across all text sizes

layoutSystem.methodology: Flexbox-first with Grid for complex layouts
layoutSystem.containerStrategy: Full-height layouts with sidebar + main content pattern

appShell.structure: Fixed sidebar (256px) + flexible main content area
appShell.behavior: Collapsible sidebar with toggle, transforms off-canvas on mobile
appShell.responsiveness: Mobile: overlay sidebar with backdrop blur, Desktop: persistent sidebar

contentGrid.medium: grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 - tablets and small desktops
contentGrid.large: grid-cols-4 lg:grid-cols-4 - large desktops for card grids
contentGrid.gaps: gap-3 (12px) for tight layouts, gap-4 (16px) for standard spacing, gap-6 (24px) for loose layouts

flexPatterns.cardContent: flex flex-col gap-2 - vertical stacking with consistent spacing
flexPatterns.iconText: flex items-center gap-3 - icons paired with text

spacing.gaps: Prefer gap utilities over margin for spacing between flex/grid children
spacing.sections: space-y-4 or space-y-8 between major sections

responsive.hiddenElements: hidden md:flex for desktop-only, md:hidden for mobile-only

cards.borderRadius: rounded-3xl (24px) - heavily rounded for modern aesthetic
cards.borders: border or border-2 depending on emphasis
cards.shadow: Minimal shadows, rely on borders for depth

buttons.iconPlacement: mr-2 for left icons, ml-2 for right icons

badges.borderRadius: rounded-xl (12px) or rounded-full for pill style
badges.usage: Status indicators, category tags, notification counts
badges.placement: Top-right of cards, inline with text, as metadata

inputs.withIcons: Absolute positioned icons (left-3 top-3) with pl-9 padding

navigation.sidebarItems: rounded-2xl with hover:bg-muted, active gets bg-primary/10 text-primary
navigation.tabs: TabsList with rounded-2xl container, TabsTrigger rounded-xl
navigation.collapsible: ChevronDown icon with rotate-180 transform on expand

progress.usage: Project completion, installation progress, learning paths

backgroundGradient.animate: Cycles through different radial gradient positions

transitions.mode: AnimatePresence with mode='wait' for tab switching

icons.colorStrategy: Individual vibrant colors per icon for visual variety
icons.usage: Paired with text in navigation, feature cards, buttons

images.placeholder: /placeholder.svg with query parameters for semantic descriptions
images.hoverEffect: scale-105 transition on image hover for engagement

backgroundPatterns.heroSections: Vibrant multi-color gradients (3 colors) with from/via/to pattern
backgroundPatterns.ambient: Animated radial gradient overlay at 20% opacity
backgroundPatterns.structure: Linear gradients for featured sections, radial for ambient effects

metrics.usage: File counts, member counts, view counts, engagement metrics

badges.status: Colored badges for categories, levels, and states
badges.counts: Outline badges with numbers for notifications and counts

hoverStates.cards: Border color shift + scale + vertical lift

sections.name: Hero/Featured Section
sections.pattern: Gradient background with CTA buttons, badge accent, large heading

sections.name: Card Grid Section
sections.pattern: Heading + grid of cards with consistent structure
sections.spacing: space-y-4 between heading and grid, gap-3 in grid

sections.name: List/Table Section
sections.spacing: p-4 per row, divide-y for separators

sections.name: Two-Column Split
sections.usage: Recent files + Active projects side by side

mobile.navigation: Hamburger menu opens overlay sidebar with backdrop
mobile.buttons: Full width CTAs in hero sections

desktop.maxWidth: No max-width constraints, uses full viewport
desktop.decorative: Animated gradient backgrounds and decorative elements visible

patterns: useState for local UI state (sidebar, tabs, mobile menu)

accessibilityPatterns.tooltips: TooltipProvider wrapping icon buttons with descriptive content
accessibilityPatterns.badges: Semantic variants (outline, secondary) for different contexts
accessibilityPatterns.semanticHTML: main, section, header tags for structure

designPrinciples.roundness: Heavy use of rounded corners (16-24px) for friendly, modern feel
designPrinciples.colorApproach: Neutral base with vibrant gradient accents for features
designPrinciples.whitespace: Generous padding and gaps for breathing room
designPrinciples.consistency: Repeating patterns across all sections (cards, buttons, badges)
designPrinciples.hierarchy: Clear visual hierarchy through size, weight, and color
designPrinciples.motion: Subtle animations enhance user experience without distraction
designPrinciples.density: Balanced information density with appropriate grouping

keyFeatures: Collapsible sidebar navigation with nested items
replicationSteps: 1. Establish 5-color palette: 1 primary (neutral), 2 supporting neutrals, vibrant gradient accents, borders
2. Set up 2 font families (sans + mono) with consistent scale
3. Create app shell with fixed sidebar (256px) + flexible main content
4. Use rounded-3xl for cards, rounded-2xl for buttons/inputs, rounded-xl for smaller elements
5. Implement gradient hero sections with from-via-to pattern using 3 colors
6. Build card grids with consistent gap-3 spacing
7. Add hover states: card scale + lift, border color shifts
8. Use Framer Motion for page transitions and interactive elements
9. Apply vibrant colors to individual icons for visual variety
10. Implement mobile-first responsive breakpoints with overlay sidebar
